summary: This is a press guidance email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It provides logistical information for the media, including details about witness pseudonyms, a final pretrial conference, and access to exhibits. The document emphasizes the protection of victim-witness privacy.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice minors to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity. Her trial is the subject of this press guidance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the individual with whom Ghislaine Maxwell conspired to commit the alleged crimes.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge over the final pretrial conference and the trial in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jim Margolin
persons.context: A colleague in the SDNY press office who can be contacted to establish access to the government's exhibit file share.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Epstein to entice minors to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity.

events.title: Press Guidance Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY issues press guidance for the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing procedures for media, witness pseudonyms, and exhibit access.

events.title: Final Pretrial Conference
events.description: A final pretrial conference is scheduled for the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Alison Nathan.

keyFacts: The government anticipates that several victim-witnesses will testify at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial using a pseudonym or first name, a measure granted by the court to protect their privacy.
The press guidance explicitly urges media outlets to abide by policies against identifying sex crime victims without their consent.
Government exhibits for the trial will be provided exclusively through a secure SDNY file share (USAFx), requiring media to establish access accounts.
The document confirms the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell: conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice minors to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity.
